diagrams.description: A timeline showing the history of Computer Vision.
diagrams.mermaid_code:
timeline
    title: The History of Computer Vision
    section: The 1960s - The Birth of a Field
        1966: The Summer Vision Project at MIT
        1960s: Early work on edge detection and object recognition
    section: The 1970s - The Rise of 3D Vision
        1970s: David Marr's work on the computational theory of vision
        1970s: Development of algorithms for stereo vision and motion analysis
    section: The 1980s - The Influence of AI
        1980s: The rise of expert systems and knowledge-based vision
        1982: The first Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR)
    section: The 1990s - The Rise of Statistical Methods
        1990s: The use of statistical methods and machine learning
        1999: The Viola-Jones algorithm for real-time face detection
    section: The 2000s - The Rise of Big Data
        2000s: The development of large-scale image datasets (e.g., ImageNet)
    section: The 2010s - The Deep Learning Revolution
        2012: AlexNet wins the ImageNet competition
        2010s: The rise of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for image recognition
        2010s: The development of generative adversarial networks (GANs)
